intro: Triumfetta annua f. piligera, commonly known as the hairy annual triumfetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in disturbed soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
